com.bfg.customer
Class CreditCard

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.bfg.customer.CreditCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class CreditCard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Holds the credit card information used in the wallet and in recorded orders.

Copyright 2002, James M. Turner No warranty is made as to the fitness of this code for any particular purpose. It is included for demonstration purposes only.

Author:
James M. Turner

Method Detail

getCardID

public int getCardID()
Returns the unique Card ID, which is an autoincrementing database column used to uniquely identify each credit card record.
Returns:
the card ID

setCardID

public void setCardID(int id)
Sets the unique card ID, which is an autoincrementing database column used to uniquely identify each card record. Note that in normal usage, this should not be used because IDs are assigned by the database.
Parameters:
id - the card ID

                              int expYear)
    Validates that the expiration date is after today.
    Parameters:

    expYear - The expiration year
    Returns:
    true if the date is valid, otherwise false

    validateCreditCardNumber

    public boolean validateCreditCardNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)
    Validates the credit card against the standard prefixes and checksums for credit card numbers
    Parameters:
    cardNumber - The credit card number
    Returns:
    true if the number is valid, otherwise false

    validateCreditCard

    public boolean validateCreditCard()
    Validates the credit card against a number of checks including missing fields, invalid expiration date and bad checksum on the card number.
    Returns:
    true if the card passes the validation checks, otherwise false

    findCreditCard

    public static CreditCard findCreditCard(int cardID)
                                 throws CustomerActivityException
    Given an card ID, returns a new card object populated from the database, or null if no such card exists.
    Parameters:
    ID - The unique ID of the card in the database
    Returns:
    A populated CreditCard object, or null if none found.
    Throws:
    CustomeryActivityException - Thrown on database errors
